titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Ray J. Green papers, 1919-1980

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Miranda Webster March 2014

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

did.abstract: Ray J. Green was invovled in the aviation industry. This collection contains his professional papers.

bioghist.head: Biography of Ray J. Green
bioghist.p: Ray J. Green was an air mail pioneer. He left U.S. Air Mail and began working on the S.S. Leviathan, a luxury ocean liner. In 1936, he was a traffic controller for the Civil Aviation Authority in Denver.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains correspondence; airplane scale models of World War I De Havilland DH4 and the Galloping Goose Ford; publications by Green and others about aviation; brochures; books; various newsletters; yearbooks; and photographs of early aviators, planes, plane crushes and of Ray J. Green.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on the materials for research purposes, and the collection is open to the public.

userestrict.head: Copyright Information
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for observing all copyright, property, and libel laws as they apply.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: There are no known other archival collections created by Ray J. Green at the date of processing.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This material was received from Ray J. Green in July 1973; October 1973; October 1973; August 1974; December 1974; January 1975; March 1975; June 1975; July 1975; February 1976; July 1976; May 1978; September 1979; November 1980; and January 1981.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Item Description, Box Number, Folder Number, Collection Name, Collection Number, American Heritage Center, University of Wyoming.

scopecontent.p: The American Heritage Center is in the process of converting its older container lists to a more accessible format. This link is to an older version of a container list.
